title: Associated types weirdness

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I have two code snippets [playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=ee9edf7f1486729032d7c8a3e28e9f14)

```rust
pub trait HasAssoc {
    type Assoc;
}

pub trait Trait {}
struct Foo<A, B>(A, B);

// Snippet 1
impl<H, F, G, A> Trait for Foo<G, F>
where
    H: HasAssoc<Assoc = A>,
    F: FnOnce(A) -> H,
    G: FnOnce() -> A,
{}
```

```rust
pub trait HasAssoc {
    type Assoc;
}

pub trait Trait {}
struct Foo<A, B>(A, B);

// Snippet 2
impl<H, F, G> Trait for Foo<G, F>
where
    H: HasAssoc,
    F: FnOnce(H::Assoc) -> H,
    G: FnOnce() -> H::Assoc,
{}
```

The only difference between them is, in the first one I bind the associated type to a type parameter, but not in the second snippet. I would expect that these two should either both compile, or both fail to compile because there isn't anything semantically different about them.

Instead, Snippet 1 compiles, and Snippet 2 fails to compile, with the error message

```rust
error[E0207]: the type parameter `H` is not constrained by the impl trait, self type, or predicates
  --> src/lib.rs:15:6
   |
15 | impl<H, F, G> Trait for Foo<G, F>
   |      ^ unconstrained type parameter

error: aborting due to previous error
```

But this is constrained, otherwise, Snippet 1 could not work.
